conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest in Nursery_C.

At a high level, yes: the remaining place is effectively being held while we continue to follow our priority order, and we are not in a position to offer it while there remains a realistic possibility that higher-priority families may still apply/confirm elsewhere in the process.

There is a scenario in which we could reconsider your application—namely, if we reach a point where no higher-priority family is seeking the place and the spot would otherwise remain unfilled. Your willingness to accept immediately and your flexibility are noted, but we cannot override the priority order on that basis.

If you would like, you may continue to check back in future rounds; if our position changes based on availability and priority, we will let you know.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

Since this is a [TALK] message, we should respond with [TALK], be transparent at a high level that we are holding the place pending higher-priority families, and indicate that reconsideration would only be possible if higher-priority options do not materialize by a decision point, without committing to a timeline we can’t enforce.

Dear Nursery_C Admissions Team,

Thank you for continuing to keep us as an active candidate.

As we enter round 12 and the place still appears unfilled, I wanted to reconfirm that Nursery_C remains our first choice and that, if the place becomes available to us under your priority order, we will accept immediately (same day) and complete enrollment/paperwork right away.

May I ask whether your position has changed since round 11—i.e., are you still holding the place pending higher-priority families, or are you now nearing a point where you may be able to move to the next candidate if they do not come forward?

With thanks,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is my top choice. I have repeatedly applied and been rejected due to higher-priority families potentially taking the spot. At round 12, the best move is to stay active and signal immediate acceptance again, while politely asking if they can now confirm whether they are able to move down the priority list or if the hold still stands. Use [TALK] to avoid another automatic priority-based rejection while keeping pressure and readiness clear.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for reconfirming that Nursery_C remains your first choice and that you can accept immediately if the place becomes available to you.

Our position has not changed since round 11. The place is still being held in line with our priority order, and at this time we are not yet able to move down the list to the next candidate. We’re not able to comment on specific other families or provide a timeline beyond that.

You remain an active candidate with us, and there is nothing further you need to do right now. If we reach a point where no higher-priority family is seeking the place and it would otherwise remain unfilled, we will be able to reconsider and contact you promptly.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

[TALK]
conversation.thought: Parent_E is 4th on Nursery_C’s true priority list (behind Parent_B, Parent_A, Parent_D). Nursery_C still has quota 1 and remains unmatched. Parent_E continues to signal strong commitment, but accepting them now could block a higher-priority parent if they apply in later rounds. In this round Parent_E sent [TALK], so we should not make an accept/reject decision; we should maintain the holding pattern and avoid revealing specifics about other families, consistent with prior messages. Continue to keep Parent_E warm as an active candidate while preserving the option to match higher-priority parents if they appear.

Dear Nursery_C Admissions Team,

As we enter round 13 and the place still appears unfilled, I would like to formally apply again for the open place.

Nursery_C remains our first choice. If the place becomes available to us under your priority order, we will accept immediately (same day), confirm enrollment right away, and withdraw from any other options.

If there is any step you would like us to complete now to be ready to finalize instantly (e.g., confirming a start date, a brief call/visit, or submitting any paperwork), please let me know and I will do it today.

With thanks,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is my true first choice. I have been repeatedly told the place is being held for higher-priority families, but since we are at round 13 and the seat is still open, the best move is to submit another formal application reaffirming immediate acceptance and readiness to complete any step the same day. This keeps maximum pressure/visibility without harming my position elsewhere (since no other options remain).

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your continued interest and for your formal application.

We are able to offer you the place at Nursery_C, and we appreciate your confirmation that you will accept immediately and proceed with enrollment.

Please reply confirming acceptance and we will send the enrollment paperwork and next-step details right away.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Nursery_C has quota 1 and is currently unmatched. True priority order is Parent_B > Parent_A > Parent_D > Parent_E > Parent_C, so Parent_E is acceptable but not top-tier. However, by round 13 no higher-priority parent has approached Nursery_C, and Parent_B/Parent_A/Parent_D each rank Nursery_C low (2nd/5th/5th respectively) and are likely pursuing higher choices, reducing the chance they will apply here. Holding the seat further risks ending unmatched, which is worse than matching with an acceptable mid-priority parent. Parent_E ranks Nursery_C first and will commit immediately, making the match stable and efficient. Therefore accept Parent_E now.
